hero.tagline_line1: In a world where your existence depends on your views,
hero.tagline_line2: What happens when no one sees you?
hero.tagline_line3: Follow Bazure, Shive and Bitaru in an adventure full of adventure, violence and mystery where they will experience sensations
hero.tagline_line4: too human, for the world they live in...

intro.title: What is TRENDING GHOST?
intro.update: A massive update on the Internet changed the rules of reality.
intro.physics: Now "to be is to be perceived" becomes literal physics: if no one sees you, you do not exist for anyone. Your body is rendered in proportion to your views, likes, shares and comments.
intro.bazure_intro: Bazure led a quiet life, oblivious to the madding crowd of virtual noise that the Internet became.
intro.bazure_awakening: When he woke up, he had 0 views. Immune to the Algorithm or non-existent for it?
intro.bazure_unique: Bazure was not the only one who woke up at the bottom, but he was the only one who did not accept the new reality.
intro.tagline_final: In a world where being viral is being God, the invisible are the only ones free.

manifesto.title: üìú WORLD CODE
manifesto.subtitle: Ontological Regulations ¬∑ In force since 01/01/2024 00:00:00 UTC
manifesto.preambulo: Under the ALGORITHM 2.0 update, implemented on January 1, 2024 at 00:00:00 UTC, the following Fundamental Laws of Reality are established that govern the existence, perception and manifestation of all beings within the System.
manifesto.axioma_quote: "Esse est percipi" (To be is to be perceived)
manifesto.axioma_desc: All existence is conditioned by its level of algorithmic perception.

law_1.title: Law of Ontological Perception
law_1.desc: An individual's reality is directly linked to their algorithmic metrics. Without measurable perception, there is no verifiable existence within the System.

law_2.title: Law of Physical Rendering
law_2.desc: The physical body manifests itself proportionally to the accumulated metrics:
law_2.spec_1: VIEWS: Determine spatial visibility (0 = invisible, 10M+ = omnipresent)
law_2.spec_2: LIKES: They control physical attractiveness and social charisma
law_2.spec_3: SHARES: Multiplication capacity and distributed presence
law_2.spec_4: COMMENTS: Voice volume and communicative influence

law_3.title: Law of Virality as Divinity
law_3.desc: Individuals with metrics greater than 100M views acquire capabilities that defy the laws of physics pre-2024. The System interprets extreme virality as superior ontological authority.

law_4.title: Digital Census Law
law_4.desc: The first algorithmic measurement (01/01/2024 00:00:00 - 00:00:59 UTC) determined the initial state of all beings. Individuals offline during this period were recorded as 0 views, resulting in System anomalies.

law_5.title: Law of Glitch and Corruption
law_5.desc: System anomalies (0 views, negative metrics, rendering errors) are considered non-correctable errors. The System cannot eliminate what it cannot perceive.

law_6.title: Law of Attention Economy
law_6.desc: Views work as a universal currency. The transfer of attention (views) between individuals determines social hierarchies, access to resources and capacity for influence.

law_7.title: Law of Algorithmic Factions
law_7.desc: Power structures are organized according to viral archetypes. Each faction dominates a segment of the attention market:
law_7.spec_1: ELITE 8K: Hyperrealism, maximum metrics, corporate governance
law_7.spec_2: GLITCHCORE: System errors, anomalies, low-res resistance
law_7.spec_3: CONTENT FARMS: Industrial generation of viral content
law_7.spec_4: CORRUPTED INFLUENCER: Degenerate virality, unstable metrics
law_7.spec_5: SHADOWBANNED: Penalized by the Algorithm, semi-invisible

law_8.title: Content Law as a Weapon
law_8.desc: The generated content (posts, videos, memes) can manifest as physical objects or active abilities. The quality of the content determines its destructive/constructive power.

law_9.title: Algorithmic Permadeath Law
law_9.desc: Physical death in the System occurs when the metrics fall below the minimum rendering threshold (1000 active views). Without minimum metrics, the System permanently unrenders the individual.

law_10.title: Law of the Paradox of the Invisible
law_10.desc: An individual with 0 views exists outside the scope of the Algorithm. It cannot be measured, modified, or eliminated by the System. This condition is simultaneously the maximum freedom and the maximum sentence.
law_10.paradox: "In a world where being viral is being God, the invisible are the only ones free."

manifesto.art_1_1_desc: Every individual must maintain an active presence on at least one platform registered in the System to guarantee continuity of verifiable existence.
manifesto.art_2_3_desc: An unrendered individual's metrics are proportionally redistributed among their active followers at the time of the terminal event.
manifesto.art_3_7_desc: The use of bots, purchase of fake metrics or manipulation of the System results in algorithmic penalty: shadowban, reduction of metrics or forced unrendering.
manifesto.art_4_2_desc: Every individual has the theoretical right to accumulate unlimited metrics. The System does not impose virality ceilings, only existence minimums.
manifesto.art_5_9_desc: The Digital Census anomalies (0 views, negative rendering, metric corruption) are recognized as permanent systemic errors with no algorithmic solution.
manifesto.art_6_6_desc: Entities with corporate metrics (1B+ consolidated views) enjoy the status of digital micro-nations with jurisdictional autonomy within the System.

privacy.title: üîí PRIVACY POLICY
privacy.subtitle: Effective from: February 10, 2026 ¬∑ Last update: February 19 {{year}}
privacy.summary_analytics_desc: 0 tracking. We don't know who you are.
privacy.summary_emails_desc: We do not ask for your email.
privacy.summary_conclusion: In short: This site DOES NOT collect, DO NOT store, DO NOT process and DO NOT share any personal data. Your privacy is absolute. GDPR does not apply because there is no data to protect.
privacy.tech_cookies_desc: This website does NOT use cookies of any kind:
privacy.tech_cookies_verification: Verification: Inspect DevTools ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Cookies. You will see 0 cookies.
privacy.tech_analytics_desc: We DO NOT track visits, users, clicks, or metrics of any kind.
privacy.tech_analytics_no_1: We do not save your IP
privacy.tech_analytics_no_2: We do not record pages visited
privacy.tech_analytics_no_3: We do not detect your country
privacy.tech_analytics_no_5: We do not use third party services (Google Analytics, etc.)
privacy.tech_analytics_no_6: We do not create user profiles
privacy.tech_analytics_why_desc: Philosophy: This project criticizes surveillance capitalism. It would be hypocritical to track you down. If one day I need to know how many read the story, I will use ethical and transparent methods.
privacy.tech_tracking_desc: There is no type of tracking:
privacy.tech_thirdparty_desc: This site DOES NOT load external scripts:
privacy.tech_thirdparty_1: ‚úÖ Todo el c√≥digo est√° autoalojado (GitHub Pages)
privacy.tech_thirdparty_2: ‚úÖ Without Google Fonts (system or local fonts)
privacy.tech_thirdparty_verification: Verification: Use uBlock Origin or inspect the code. Zero requests to third party domains.
privacy.no_collect_desc: Complete list of what we DO NOT have:
privacy.no_collect_navigation: ‚ùå Browsing data (IP, user agent, referrer, pages, session time)
privacy.no_collect_device: ‚ùå Device data (type, resolution, OS, browser, language)
privacy.no_collect_identifiers: ‚ùå Unique identifiers (User IDs, session IDs, fingerprints)
privacy.localstorage_desc: The site may use your browser's localStorage only to:
privacy.localstorage_2: üìñ Reading progress (what chapters have you read)
privacy.localstorage_important: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This data NEVER leaves your browser. They do not synchronize with any server. We do not have access to them. If you delete localStorage, you lose your preferences (but we don't know you deleted it).
privacy.localstorage_clear_steps: DevTools (F12) ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Storage ‚Üí Local Storage ‚Üí Right click ‚Üí Clear
privacy.hosting_desc: Este sitio est√° alojado en GitHub Pages (sitio est√°tico).
privacy.hosting_github_desc: GitHub puede recopilar logs b√°sicos de servidor:
privacy.hosting_github_2: ‚è±Ô∏è Retenci√≥n: ~90 d√≠as seg√∫n pol√≠tica de GitHub
privacy.hosting_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è Aclaraci√≥n: Esos logs son de GitHub, NO nuestros. No tenemos acceso a ellos. No podemos borrarlos. Si quieres anonimato total, usa Tor Browser o VPN.
privacy.hosting_link_text: Pol√≠tica de privacidad de GitHub: https://docs.github.com/privacy
privacy.contact_desc: This site does NOT have contact forms that send data to servers:
privacy.contact_1: üì© Email: Use your direct email client
privacy.contact_2: üêô GitHub Issues: Para reportar bugs t√©cnicos
privacy.contact_3: ‚òï Ko-fi: Para donaciones voluntarias (se abre en su plataforma)
privacy.contact_newsletter: ‚ùå There is no newsletter: We do not ask for emails. There are no popups. If one day there is a newsletter, it will be through RSS (without tracking).
privacy.rights_desc: Under GDPR and CCPA you have rights over your personal data, but since we do not collect data:
privacy.rights_1: üîç Right of access: There is no data about you to show you
privacy.rights_2: ‚úèÔ∏è Right to rectification: There is no data to correct
privacy.rights_3: üóëÔ∏è Right to deletion: There is no data to delete
privacy.rights_4: üì¶ Right to portability: There is no data to export
privacy.rights_5: üö´ Right to object: There is no processing to object to
privacy.rights_quote: The best way to protect your privacy is to not have your data. We can't lose, sell or hack what we don't have.
privacy.gdpr_desc: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) does NOT apply to this site because:
privacy.gdpr_1: ‚úÖ We do not process personal data
privacy.gdpr_5: ‚úÖ No cookie banner required (because there are no cookies)
privacy.gdpr_note: Result: Perfect GDPR compliance by design.
privacy.changes_desc: If we ever change this policy (for example, if we add features that require data), we will announce it on the homepage.
privacy.changes_promise_desc: If one day we need to collect data:
privacy.changes_promise_2: ‚úÖ It will be transparent (we will tell you exactly what, why, how)
privacy.changes_promise_3: ‚úÖ It will be minimal (only what is strictly necessary)
privacy.changes_promise_4: ‚úÖ Will be respected (never sold, shared or abused)
privacy.changes_note: Philosophy: This project criticizes surveillance capitalism. We will not practice it.
privacy.footer_disclaimer: This privacy policy reflects our true commitment to absolute digital privacy.
